title: Packing Triangles in Weighted Graphs

lemmas.name: fractional_bound_improved
lemmas.statement: theorem fractional_bound_improved (G : SimpleGraph V) : (triangleCoveringNumber G : ℝ) ≤ 2 * fractionalPackingNumber G - (1/Real.sqrt 6) * Real.sqrt (fractionalPackingNumber G)
implications: Tighter than τ ≤ 2ν* for large ν*
Shows gap between τ and 2ν* grows with ν*

lemmas.name: fractional_bound_tight
lemmas.statement: The bound τ ≤ 2ν* - Θ(√ν*) is essentially best possible

lemmas.name: weighted_tuza
lemmas.english: Tuza-type bounds hold in weighted setting

key_insight: Improves Krivelevich's τ ≤ 2ν* by a term of order √ν*. For large graphs, there's guaranteed slack between τ and 2ν*.
implications_for_nu4: For nu=4: ν* could be larger, giving more slack
If ν* = 4, improvement is ~1.63 (small but nonzero)
Suggests counterexamples need ν* close to ν
notes: Answers Krivelevich's question about tightness of τ ≤ 2ν*
